option.value: {"C:/portifolioJM/appReservations/web.reservas":"{\"/src/test/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/ApplicationForHouseBookingAndReservationsApplicationTests.java\":\"This file appears to be a test class for a Spring Boot application called \\\"ApplicationForHouseBookingAndReservationsApplication\\\". The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test method `contextLoads()` that is used to ensure the application context loads successfully.\\n\\nThe file can be summarized as follows:\\n\\n`ApplicationForHouseBookingAndReservationsApplicationTests`: A test class for the Spring Boot application that checks if the application context loads correctly.\\n\\n`contextLoads()`: A test method that verifies the application context loads successfully.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/repository/CustomerDAO.java\":\"This file contains a Java interface named `CustomerDAO` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface from the Spring Data JPA library. The `CustomerDAO` interface provides methods for interacting with a `Customer` entity in a database.\\n\\n`CustomerDAO`: An interface that provides methods for interacting with a `Customer` entity in a database.\\n\\n`findByEmail(String email)`: Retrieves a `Customer` entity by their email address.\\n`existsByEmail(String email)`: Checks if a `Customer` entity with the given email address exists.\\n`existsByCpf(String cpf)`: Checks if a `Customer` entity with the given CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas FÃ­sicas) number exists.\\n`findByFullName(String fullName)`: Retrieves a `Customer` entity by their full name.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/dto/ReservationDTO.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`ReservationDTO`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a reservation, containing information about the customer, the unit, the check-in and check-out dates.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to transfer reservation data between different parts of the application.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/entity/Reservation.java\":\"This file defines the `Reservation` entity class, which represents a reservation in a hotel or accommodation system. The class has several fields, including the booking date, check-in and check-out dates, total amount, status, payment status, and relationships with `Customer` and `Unit` entities.\\n\\n`Reservation`: An entity class that represents a reservation in a hotel or accommodation system.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/repository/UnitDAO.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `UnitDAO` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`UnitDAO`: An interface that provides CRUD operations and custom query methods for the `Unit` entity.\\n\\n`findByParentId(Long parentId)`: A custom query method that retrieves a list of `Unit` entities based on the provided `parentId`.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/security/UsuarioToken.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`UsuarioToken`: A class that represents a user token, containing a token string.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, only a constructor and getter/setter methods for the token property.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/auth/IAuthService.java\":\"This file defines an interface `IAuthService` that provides two functions:\\n\\n`criarUsuario`: Creates a new `Customer` user.\\n`realizarLogin`: Performs a login operation for a `Customer` user and returns a `UsuarioToken`.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to define the interface for an authentication service that handles user creation and login operations.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/entity/Unit.java\":\"This file defines a `Unit` entity class for a web application that manages reservations. The class represents a unit, which can have a parent-child relationship with other units, and contains information such as the unit\\u0027s name, capacity, default price, and description.\\n\\n`Unit`: This class represents a unit in the web application\\u0027s reservation system, with properties such as name, parent unit, capacity, default price, and description.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, as it is solely focused on defining the `Unit` entity class using the Lombok library for generating boilerplate code.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/reservation/IReservationService.java\":\"This file defines an interface `IReservationService` that provides methods for managing reservations.\\n\\n`IReservationService`: An interface that defines the methods for managing reservations.\\n\\n`save(Reservation reservation)`: Saves a new reservation.\\n`update(Long id, Reservation reservation)`: Updates an existing reservation.\\n`canceled(Long id)`: Cancels a reservation.\\n`findById(Long id)`: Retrieves a reservation by its ID.\\n`delete(Long id)`: Deletes a reservation.\\n`findAll()`: Retrieves all reservations.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/unit/UnitServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a service implementation for managing units in a web application.\\n\\n`UnitServiceImpl`: A service implementation that provides CRUD operations for managing units.\\n\\n`save(UnitDTO dto)`: Saves a new unit or updates an existing one, handling the hierarchy logic.\\n\\n`findAll()`: Retrieves a list of all units.\\n\\n`findById(Long id)`: Retrieves a unit by its ID.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/controller/CustomerController.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot controller class for managing customer-related operations in a web application.\\n\\n`CustomerController`: This class is responsible for handling HTTP requests related to customer management, such as retrieving, creating, and updating customer information.\\n\\n`getAll()`: This function retrieves a list of all customers.\\n\\n`getById(Long id)`: This function retrieves a customer by their unique identifier (ID).\\n\\n`getByName(String fullName)`: This function retrieves a customer by their full name.\\n\\n`createCustomer(Customer novo)`: This function creates a new customer.\\n\\n`updateCustomer(Long id, Customer customerAtualizado)`: This function updates an existing customer\\u0027s information.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/controller/UnitController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Spring Boot controller class for managing units in a web application.\\n\\n`UnitController`: A REST controller class that handles CRUD operations for units.\\n\\n`create`: Creates a new unit based on the provided `UnitDTO`.\\n`listAll`: Retrieves a list of all units.\\n`getById`: Retrieves a unit by its ID.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/repository/ReservationDAO.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `ReservationDAO` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA. The purpose of this interface is to define custom database queries for the `Reservation` entity.\\n\\n`ReservationDAO`: An interface that extends `JpaRepository` to provide custom database queries for the `Reservation` entity.\\n\\n`findConflictingReservations`: A method that retrieves a list of active (non-canceled) reservations for a specific unit that overlap with the given check-in and check-out dates.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/security/MyFilter.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`MyFilter`: A custom filter that checks the authorization header in the request and sets the authentication context if the token is valid.\\n\\n`doFilterInternal`: This function is called by the Spring Security framework to filter the incoming request. It checks the authorization header, decodes the token, and sets the authentication context if the token is valid. If the token is invalid, it sets the response status to 401 (Unauthorized).\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to implement a custom filter that handles authentication and authorization for the web application\\u0027s reservation system.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/auth/AuthServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains an implementation of the `IAuthService` interface, which provides functionality for user authentication and registration.\\n\\n`AuthServiceImpl`: This class implements the `IAuthService` interface and provides methods for creating new users and performing user login.\\n\\n`crearUsuario`: This function creates a new user by encoding the user\\u0027s email using BCrypt and saving the user to the database.\\n\\n`realizarLogin`: This function performs user login by finding the user in the database based on the provided email, and then verifying the password using BCrypt. If the login is successful, it returns a `UsuarioToken` object containing the user\\u0027s information and a JWT token.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/customer/CustomerServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class `CustomerServiceImpl` that implements the `ICustomerService` interface. The class provides CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for managing customer data in a web application.\\n\\n`CustomerServiceImpl`: A service class that handles the business logic for managing customer data, including creating, updating, and retrieving customers.\\n\\n`insertCustomer`: Inserts a new customer into the database, ensuring that the email and CPF are unique.\\n\\n`updateCustomer`: Updates an existing customer\\u0027s information, such as phone number, country of origin, preferred language, and notes.\\n\\n`findById`: Retrieves a customer by their unique ID.\\n\\n`getName`: Retrieves a customer by their full name.\\n\\n`getAll`: Retrieves a list of all customers.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/customer/ICustomerService.java\":\"This file contains an interface named `ICustomerService` that defines the following functions:\\n\\n`insertCustomer`: Inserts a new customer into the system.\\n`updateCustomer`: Updates an existing customer in the system.\\n`findById`: Retrieves a customer by their unique identifier.\\n`getName`: Retrieves a customer by their name.\\n`getAll`: Retrieves a list of all customers in the system.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to define the contract for a service that manages customer-related operations, such as creating, updating, and retrieving customer information.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/ApplicationForHouseBookingAndReservationsApplication.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is the main application class for a Spring Boot application that is used for house booking and reservations. The `@SpringBootApplication` annotation is used to enable auto-configuration and component scanning, and the `main()` method is the entry point for the application, which runs the Spring application context.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/security/TokenUtil.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `TokenUtil` that provides functionality for generating and validating JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for user authentication and authorization.\\n\\n`TokenUtil`: A utility class that provides methods for encoding and decoding JWT tokens.\\n\\n`encode(Customer customer)`: Generates a JWT token for the given `Customer` object.\\n\\n`decode(HttpServletRequest request)`: Decodes a JWT token from the `Authorization` header of the given `HttpServletRequest` and returns an `Authentication` object.\\n\\n`isValid(String subject, String issuer, Date exp)`: Checks if the given JWT token is valid based on the subject, issuer, and expiration date.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/security/WebSecurityConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring Security configuration class that sets up the security settings for a web application.\\n\\n`WebSecurityConfig`: This class configures the security settings for the web application, including CSRF protection, CORS configuration, and authorization rules for different HTTP methods and endpoints.\\n\\n`securityFilterChain`: This function configures the security filter chain, which is responsible for handling authentication and authorization for incoming requests.\\n\\n`corsConfigurationSource`: This function configures the CORS settings for the web application, allowing requests from a specific origin and specifying the allowed methods and headers.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/unit/IUnitService.java\":\"This file contains an interface named `IUnitService` that defines the methods for managing units in a reservation system.\\n\\n`IUnitService`: An interface that provides methods for managing units in a reservation system.\\n\\n`save(UnitDTO dto)`: Saves a new unit based on the provided `UnitDTO` object.\\n`findAll()`: Retrieves a list of all units.\\n`findById(Long Id)`: Finds a unit by its unique identifier.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/entity/Customer.java\":\"This file defines a `Customer` entity class for a web application\\u0027s reservation system.\\n\\n`Customer`: A class that represents a customer with various attributes such as full name, email, phone number, CPF, passport number, birth date, preferred language, country of origin, and notes.\\n\\n`onCreate()`: A pre-persist function that sets the `createdAt` timestamp and the default preferred language to \\\"pt\\\" if it is not provided.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for defining the `Customer` entity, which is likely used for managing customer information in the web application\\u0027s reservation system.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/controller/ReservationController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for managing reservations.\\n\\n`ReservationController`: A REST controller class that handles CRUD operations for reservations, including creating, updating, and deleting reservations, as well as confirming payment for a reservation.\\n\\n`findAll()`: Retrieves a list of all reservations.\\n\\n`findById(Long id)`: Retrieves a specific reservation by its ID.\\n\\n`createReservation(ReservationDTO dto)`: Creates a new reservation based on the provided `ReservationDTO`.\\n\\n`updateReservation(Long id, ReservationDTO dto)`: Updates an existing reservation with the provided `ReservationDTO`.\\n\\n`deleteReservation(Long id)`: Cancels an existing reservation by its ID.\\n\\n`confirmPayment(Long id)`: Confirms the payment for a reservation and updates its status.\\n\\n`converterParaEntidade(ReservationDTO dto)`: A helper method that converts a `ReservationDTO` to a `Reservation` entity.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/service/reservation/ReservationServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ReservationServiceImpl` that implements the `IReservationService` interface. The class provides the implementation for managing reservations, including creating, updating, canceling, and deleting reservations, as well as validating the availability of the units being reserved.\\n\\n`ReservationServiceImpl`: Implements the logic for managing reservations, including validating availability, calculating total cost, and updating reservation status.\\n\\n`save(Reservation)`: Saves a new reservation, performing various validations and calculations.\\n`canceled(Long)`: Cancels an existing reservation by updating its status.\\n`update(Long, Reservation)`: Updates an existing reservation, re-validating availability and recalculating the total cost.\\n`findById(Long)`: Retrieves a reservation by its ID.\\n`findAll()`: Retrieves all reservations.\\n`delete(Long)`: Deletes an existing reservation.\\n`validarConflitos(Unit, Reservation)`: Validates that the given reservation does not conflict with any existing reservations for the specified unit or its parent/child units.\\n`temReservaNessePeriodo(Long, Reservation)`: Checks if there are any conflicting reservations for the specified unit and time period.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/dto/UnitDTO.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `UnitDTO`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) for representing a unit in a reservation system.\\n\\n`UnitDTO`: A DTO class that represents a unit in a reservation system, containing information such as the name, capacity, default price, description, and parent ID.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather focuses on defining the structure and properties of the `UnitDTO` class using the Lombok library to generate the necessary boilerplate code.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/entity/DailyPricing.java\":\"This file defines a JPA entity class `DailyPricing` that represents a daily pricing record for a specific unit in a reservation system.\\n\\n`DailyPricing`: A JPA entity class that represents a daily pricing record for a specific unit, including the date, price, availability, competitor price, and a reason.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but it uses Lombok annotations to generate the necessary boilerplate code for the entity class, such as constructors, getters, and setters.\",\"/src/main/java/br/com/dev/jm/web/reservas/repository/DailyPricingDAO.java\":\"This file contains a single interface named `DailyPricingDAO` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA. The purpose of this interface is to provide a way to interact with the `DailyPricing` entity in the database using the standard CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.\\n\\n`DailyPricingDAO`: An interface that provides a way to interact with the `DailyPricing` entity in the database using the standard CRUD operations.\"}"}
